alert.note: Alert for Dawes; Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 10:06PM CDT until July 03 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Dawes County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Northern Sioux County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 1000 PM MDT. * At 905 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 13 miles west of Ardmore to near Montrose to 8 miles southwest of Fort Robinson Campground to near Agate Bed National Monument, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. This storm has a history of producing widespread wind damage. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Chadron, Crawford, Harrison, Fort Robinson Campground, Chadron Campground, Whitney Lake, Red Cloud Campground, Montrose, Chadron Airport, Whitney, Fort Robinson and Chadron St Park. This replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning which was previously in effect for the warned area. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
